title: A Clinico-Pathological Study of the Correspondence Between 18F-AV-1451 PET Imaging and Post-Mortem Assessment of Tau Pathology
description_brief: This study is designed to test the relationship between ante-mortem flortaucipir Positron Emission Tomography (PET) imaging and tau neurofibrillary pathology associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD), as measured at autopsy.

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails: To be considered eligible for the primary analysis, death had to occur within 9 months of flortaucipir scan and valid autopsy was required. The first 3 subjects to come to autopsy were considered front-runners. Front-runner scan and autopsy results were unblinded to the sponsor to optimize analysis.
participantFlowModule.recruitmentDetails: Enrollment occurred between October 2015 and June 2018. Enrolled end-of-life subjects (life expectancy less than 6 months) at hospice centers in the US and Australia consented to a flortaucipir PET scan and to brain donation at autopsy.

groups.title: All Enrolled Cohort
groups.description: End-of-life subjects consenting to brain donation at autopsy from the flortaucipir PET scan arm

milestones.type: Valid Autopsy Results and PET Scan

groups.title: All Enrolled Cohort
groups.description: All subjects consenting to flortaucipir PET and brain donation at autopsy

categories.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcomeMeasures.title: Primary Outcome 1: Diagnostic Performance of Individual Readers (NFT Score)
outcomeMeasures.description: Sensitivity and specificity of 5 independent readers' interpretations of ante-mortem flortaucipir PET imaging for detection of a pattern of flortaucipir neocortical uptake that corresponds to neurofibrillary tangles (NFT) Score of B3 (Hyman et al., 2012; Montine et al., 2012). NFT B scores range from B0 (Braak Stage 0; no NFTs in the brain) to B3 (Braak Stage V/VI; widespread NFTs in the brain). Sensitivity and specificity are percentages that can range from 0 to 100%. The hypothesis tested was that, of the 5 independent imaging physicians, at least 3 will have the lower bounds of 2-sided 95% CIs ≥50%, for both sensitivity and specificity.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Autopsy cohort N=64. n=39 were truth positive for NFTs. n=25 were truth negative for NFTs.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: at autopsy within 9 months of baseline scan

groups.title: Sensitivity of Flortaucipir vs Autopsy NFT Score B3
groups.description: Subjects with a positive autopsy NFT score truth standard (NFT B3)

groups.title: Specificity of Flortaucipir vs Autopsy NFT Score <B3
groups.description: Subjects with a negative autopsy NFT score truth standard (NFT B2 or lower)

outcomeMeasures.title: Primary Outcome 2: Diagnostic Performance of Individual Readers (NIA-AA Autopsy Diagnosis)
outcomeMeasures.description: Sensitivity and specificity of 5 independent readers' interpretations of ante-mortem flortaucipir imaging for detection of a pattern of flortaucipir neocortical uptake that corresponds to high levels of Alzheimer's disease neuropathologic change (High ADNC) as defined by National Institute on Aging-Alzheimer's Association (NIA-AA) criteria. ADNC categories are None, Low, Intermediate and High, with High indicating the most severe level of AD-related pathology changes in the brain (Hyman et al., Alzheimers Dement. 2012 Jan;8(1):1-13). The hypothesis tested was that, of the 5 independent imaging physicians, at least 3 will have the lower bounds of 2-sided 95% CIs ≥50%, for both sensitivity and specificity.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Autopsy cohort N=64. n=38 were truth positive for NFTs. n=26 were truth negative for NFTs.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: at autopsy within 9 months of baseline scan

groups.title: Sensitivity of Flortaucipir vs NIA-AA Autopsy Diagnosis
groups.description: Subjects with a positive truth standard (High ADNC)

groups.title: Specificity of Flortaucipir vs NIA-AA Autopsy Diagnosis
groups.description: Subjects with a negative truth standard (No/Low/Intermediate ADNC)

outcomeMeasures.title: Flortaucipir Diagnostic Performance (NFT Score)
outcomeMeasures.description: Sensitivity and specificity of majority interpretation of AD pattern tau PET scan corresponding to NFT Score of B3. The 95% confidence intervals (CI) provided for specificity and sensitivity were based on the Wilson score method. The hypothesis tested was that majority read results had the lower bound of the 2-sided 95% CI greater than or equal to 55% for both sensitivity and specificity.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Autopsy cohort N=64. n=39 were truth positive for NFTs. n=25 were truth negative for NFTs.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: at autopsy within 9 months of baseline scan

groups.title: Sensitivity of Flortaucipir vs Autopsy NFT Score B3
groups.description: Subjects with a truth positive NFT Score (B3)

groups.title: Specificity of Flortaucipir vs Autopsy NFT Score <B3
groups.description: Subjects with a truth negative NFT Score (B2 or lower)

outcomeMeasures.title: Flortaucipir Diagnostic Performance (NIA-AA Autopsy Diagnosis)
outcomeMeasures.description: Sensitivity and specificity of majority interpretation of of AD pattern tau PET scan corresponding to NIA-AA autopsy diagnosis. The 95% CIs provided for specificity and sensitivity were based on the Wilson score method. The hypothesis tested was that majority read results had the lower bound of the 2-sided 95% CI greater than or equal to 55% for both sensitivity and specificity.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Autopsy cohort N=64. n=38 were truth positive for NFTs. n=26 were truth negative for NFTs.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: at autopsy within 9 months of baseline scan

groups.title: Sensitivity Majority Read NIA-AA Autopsy Diagnosis
groups.description: Subjects with a truth positive NIA-AA autopsy diagnosis (High ADNC)

groups.title: Specificity Majority Read NIA-AA Autopsy Diagnosis
groups.description: Subjects with truth negative NIA-AA autopsy diagnosis (No/Low/Intermediate ADNC)

outcomeMeasures.title: Inter-Reader Agreement
outcomeMeasures.description: Fleiss' Kappa statistics were used to assess inter-reader agreement for the diagnostic decisions associated with primary outcome 1. Fleiss' kappa is a statistical measure for assessing the reliability of agreement between a fixed number of raters when assigning categorical ratings to a number of items or classifying items. Fleiss' kappa can range from 0 to 1 with 1 indicating perfect agreement between the readers. Results are reported as overall agreement, calculated as proportion of scans where reader pairs agreed, divided by the total number of scans read by each reader pair.

groups.title: All Cases Read
groups.description: All participants from the study for which a visual read flortaucipir PET result was obtained (n=105), regardless of whether the subject had a valid autopsy

analyses.groupDescription: Inter-reader agreement analysis using Fleiss' kappa. The hypothesis tested was that the observed kappa values were ≥0.64 and the lower bound of the 2-sided 95% CIs were ≥0.55 for the inter-reader agreement among readers.

outcomeMeasures.title: Diagnostic Performance of Individual Readers (NFT Score B2-B3 as Truth Positive)
outcomeMeasures.description: Sensitivity and specificity of 5 independent readers' interpretations of ante-mortem flortaucipir PET imaging for detection of a pattern of flortaucipir neocortical uptake that corresponds to neurofibrillary tangles (NFT) Score of B3 (Hyman et al., 2012; Montine et al., 2012). NFT B scores range from B0 (no NFTs in the brain) to B3 (widespread NFTs in the brain). Sensitivity and specificity are percentages that can range from 0 to 100%. For this analysis, B scores of B2-B3 were considered truth positive, and B scores of B0-B1 were considered truth negative.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Autopsy cohort N=64. n=56 were truth positive for NFTs. n=8 were truth negative for NFTs.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: at autopsy within 9 months of baseline scan

groups.title: Sensitivity of Flortaucipir vs Autopsy NFT Score B2-B3
groups.description: Subjects with a positive autopsy NFT score truth standard (NFT B2 or B3)

groups.title: Specificity of Flortaucipir vs Autopsy NFT Score B0-B1
groups.description: Subjects with a negative autopsy NFT score truth standard (NFT B0 or B1)

adverseEventsModule.timeFrame: 9 months after flortaucipir scan, up to a total of 18 months if a subject was re-scanned per protocol
adverseEventsModule.description: Adverse events (AEs) were collected at scan visits, regardless of attribution to study drug. End of study for AE reporting was 48 hours after the last study drug administration. AEs occurring after study drug administration, but outside that window were not recorded, unless considered attributable to study drug.

eventGroups.title: Safety Analysis Population
eventGroups.description: All enrolled subjects from the flortaucipir PET scan arm who received one dose of flortaucipir

seriousEvents.organSystem: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

drug: flortaucipir (18F‑AV‑1451; flortaucipir F 18; commercial name TAUVID)
explanation_target: Reason: The trial compares ante‑mortem flortaucipir PET imaging to post‑mortem assessment of tau neurofibrillary pathology — this is a diagnostic/biomarker study, not a therapeutic intervention, so it does not fit the four treatment categories. citeturn0search2turn0search0

Act (key details extracted): flortaucipir (also called 18F‑AV‑1451 or flortaucipir F 18) is a radioactive PET tracer developed to bind aggregated tau neurofibrillary tangles and estimate their density and distribution in vivo; it is marketed as TAUVID and was FDA approved for this diagnostic use. citeturn0search2turn0search5turn0search0

Web search results / supporting sources found: (1) Eli Lilly TAUVID / FDA approval press and prescribing info (describes indication for PET imaging of aggregated tau NFTs). citeturn0search0turn0search2 (2) Drugs.com FDA approval history for Tauvid (flortaucipir F 18). citeturn0search5 (3) PubMed/Acta Neuropathologica and related papers reporting postmortem comparisons and binding profile of 18F‑AV‑1451 (discussing affinity for paired helical filament tau and known off‑target binding issues). citeturn0search3turn0search6 (4) Multicenter longitudinal flortaucipir PET study in aging/MCI/AD (demonstrates research use in vivo and relation to pathology/cognition). citeturn0search4

Reflect: Classification checked against definitions — flortaucipir is a diagnostic PET tracer (a radioligand), not a biologic therapeutic or small‑molecule therapy for disease modification, nor a cognitive enhancer or neuropsychiatric treatment. Therefore the correct category is 'N/A' (diagnostic study). No ambiguity in the trial description indicates a therapeutic agent; all supporting references above confirm tracer identity and diagnostic purpose. citeturn0search2turn0search6
